Posts.Content: swm63 wrote: I got my oncotype dx test results today and it was a 22.  Of course Onc. recommends TC.  I know there have been many threads about this so sorry if it is a repeat.  Plain and simple, I cannot handle losing my hair!!!  I can handle everything else that chemo brings.  All I hear everyone say is "It's only four tx and your hair will grow back.  My hair is past my bra strap and it has taken me a long time to grow it this long.  I'm convinced that even after the poison is long gone, it will take my hair at least 5 years to get back to it's current length.  I don't consider myself a vain person, but the hair is all I got. Family is trying to be supportive, but they think I am crazy for not doing TC. (Of course none of them will come out and say this)  Why is it always the ones that aren't faced with this horrible decision the ones that have the most opionions?? Anyone out there know if CMF is just as or almost as potent as TC?  Isn't CMF not supposed to make you lose all your hair, just thin out??   I have through the weekend to make my decision and I am close to losing my mind as it is. Dx 8/26/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 1/3 nodes, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: help! TC or CMF swm63 penny3333

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2008 01:17PM swm63 wrote: I had a super enlarged black colored breast and BS said it was also hematoma.  I exercised too soon after surgery and that is what caused mine.  It has been 4 weeks since it happened, and it is now totally back to normal. I too did not have drain put in after lumpectomy.  Could you have strained it somehow?

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2008 07:35PM swm63 wrote: Colleen, I am doing the CMF course of treatment for 2 weeks on, then 2 weeks off for 6 months.  This form of chemo is not as toxic as others and I have had little to no side effects after the first two treatments.  If you have any questions, I would love to help!  There is also a thread on here with all kinds of incredible women going through this tx., or have successfully completed it.  Great source of info!  Good luck!
